from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # plotting
import numpy as np # linear algebra
import os # accessing directory structure
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import seaborn as sns
source.7a76eaa0:
csv['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(csv.Date)
ax = sns.lineplot(data=csv, x='Date',y='肺炎')
ax.set_title('Googling trend of Pneumonia topic')
ax.set_ylabel('Scaled number of Googling from China')

source.aabf6b9a:
csv['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(csv.Date)
ax = sns.lineplot(data=csv, x='Date',y='冠状病毒')
ax.set_title('Googling trend of Coronavirus topic')
ax.set_ylabel('Scaled number of Googling from China')
source.a7eafa4b:
plt.plot( 'Date', '流行性感冒', data=csv, marker='', markerfacecolor='yellow', color='skyblue', linewidth=1, label="Flu")
plt.plot( 'Date', '病毒', data=csv, marker='', markerfacecolor='blue', color='skyblue', linewidth=1, label="Virus")
plt.plot( 'Date', '武汉市', data=csv, marker='', color='olive', linewidth=1, label="WuHan")
plt.plot( 'Date', '冠状病毒', data=csv, marker='', color='green', linewidth=1, linestyle='dashed', label="Coronavirus")
plt.legend()
source.f1bdf0d0:
# Wuhan 2019-nCoV Cononavirus Analysis
Hi, I think everybody at least heard about it, whether you are living in Asia or not.
As a high school data scientist, I am thinking about how I can help people in disease-outbreaking cities. However, I could not find any data online that I can make use of it. So I used Google Trend trying to get some meaningful data out of it.

**IF YOU HAVE INTERESTING DATA ABOUT 2019-nCoV THAT CAN HELP THE COMMUNITY, PLEASE SHARE!**
I just throw this to you for inspiration. I know there are smarter people out there who have access to more advanced institutions or labs. Fighting diseases make us stronger together.
